ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Everything was great
class would have benefited from a TA to coordinate between students and profnevertheless, prof was very responsive to student needs and concerns

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The speakers are the best part of the course
good overview of management approaches to issues of sustainability
Guest lecturers provided unique perspectives to lecture material.
The interaction with Colombians
The fact that Professor Brewer ran this course in four modules supplementing each module with his view was very interesting to me. I really enjoyed the group proposal and individual project.
The speakers were great, but it is difficult to get as much out of a class when there is not a lot of consistency.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: The first 4 classes were super slow.
too general -its probably hard to incorporate under grads and grad students in one class on sustainabilityclass spent a lot of time reviewing basics of sustainability and not enough time in depth
Interaction with TA was non-existent.
It needs to be more interactive because often students are not engaged in discussion
I think the class was pretty great!
More theory. More small assignments/field trips or hands on learning.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Yes, effective, could be improved if we had MANDATORY readings.
instructor did a good job of tying together class sessions with group projects / conferences with visiting faculty
Yes

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: It was a great addition to my learning plan
Excellent background into the issues facing sustainable development in third world countries.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Interested in Sustainability
i took this for an intro to management approaches for issues of sustainability, with a focus in my region of interest, Latin America
Strong interest in sustainable devp't in Latin America.
Interest in Latin America

I am interested in both the issue of sustainable development and the region of Latin America - this course was a perfect fit for that. Additionally it had elements of several other subjects which I appreciated greatly.
Sounded interesting.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: YES
class was helpful but a little too broad
Yes.
Yes
Yes.
It was useful to add a somewhat practical business perspective that was lacking in other classes. Looking back, the group projects were also helpful.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Different Backgrounds
group work gave us freedom to research an issue and make recommendations. it was a challenge bc of the diverse makeup of the class
Being from all areas of Yale, very hard to coordinate schedules and find meeting times. Groups were too large.
Advantages were that I learned a lot and got to engage with other students on the material.Disadvantages were with so many undergraduates our schedules were often conflicting
I had a wonderful experience working with my team. Most of my team members were very enthusiastic and had great ideas. I learned a lot from working with them!

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: TAKE IT ONLY IF INTERESTED IN SUSTAINABILITY IN LATAM !
consider what will be the theme during this year - the theme has varied from conservation issues to management issues
Take more advantage of Professor office hours, and do readings before lectures.
